snippet: Dealers at the inaugural fair wanted to harness the newfound wealth of the tech class, and curators hoped to highlight a connection between Pacific Northwest and Pacific Rim culture and artists.
abstract: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen brings international art scene to Seattle with establishment of Seattle Art Fair; event, inspired by founder’s visits to Venice Biennale, opens after two years of planning and aims to bring art dealers, visitors and curators to Seattle, northwest city experiencing economic and development boom.

byline.contributor: Alain Delaqueriere and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Dealers at the inaugural fair wanted to harness the newfound wealth of the tech class, and curators hoped to highlight a connection between Pacific Northwest and Pacific Rim culture and artists.

headline.main: Seattle Art Fair Receives a Boost From Tech’s Big Spenders
headline.print_headline: Seattle’s Art Scene Receives a Tech Boost
